name: disguise
trans: vt. 掩饰；假装；隐瞒 n. 伪装；假装；用作伪装的东西

sentences.english: He made no attempt to disguise his agitation.
sentences.chinese: 他无意掩饰他的不安。

sentences.english: He is a master of disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他是伪装高手。

detailed_translations.english: to hide sth or change it, so that it cannot be recognized
the art of changing your appearance so that people do not recognize you

name: enslaved
trans: v. 奴役；使成为奴隶（enslave 的过去式和过去分词）

name: escapee
trans: n. 逃避者；逃亡者

detailed_translations.english: someone who has escaped from somewhere

name: harassment
trans: n. 骚扰；烦恼

sentences.english: African-Americans have been complaining about police harassment for years.
sentences.chinese: 美国黑人多年来一直抱怨受到警察的骚扰。

detailed_translations.english: when someone behaves in an unpleasant or threatening way towards you

name: harbor
trans: n. 港，海港；避难所 v. 庇护；窝藏；怀有；为……提供庇护；入港停泊；居住，生存 n. (Harbor) （美）哈伯（人名）

sentences.english: All the battleships can refresh in this harbor.
sentences.chinese: 所有战舰都能在这个港口装上补充供应品。

sentences.english: It is the harbor of Athens.
sentences.chinese: 它是雅典的港口城。

sentences.english: She stands on a small island in New York harbor, near the great city.
sentences.chinese: 她竖立在纽约海港的一座小岛，并紧挨着纽约这座大城市。

name: segregated
trans: adj. 被隔离的 v. 隔离（segregate的过去式）；分离

name: cavalry
trans: n. 骑兵；装甲兵；装甲部队

sentences.english: The Black Prince led a cavalry charge against them.
sentences.chinese: 黑王子带领骑兵向他们冲去。

detailed_translations.english: the part of an army that fights on horses, especially in the past

name: city-state
trans: n. 城邦

name: destined
trans: adj. 注定的；命定的；去往…的 v. 注定（destine的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: The flight was destined for Cairo.
sentences.chinese: 本次航班飞往开罗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 命中注定的， 预定的； 以…为目的地的
detailed_translations.english: seeming certain to happen at some time in the future

name: persuasion
trans: n. 说服；说服力；信念；派别

sentences.english: After a little gentle persuasion , Debbie agreed to let us in.
sentences.chinese: 好言劝说了几句后，黛比就同意让我们进去了。

sentences.english: It had taken a great deal of persuasion to get him to accept.
sentences.chinese: 费尽了口舌才让他接受。

sentences.english: She used all her powers of persuasion (= skill at persuading people ) to convince Tilly that it was the right thing to do.
sentences.chinese: 她使尽浑身解数，才劝服蒂莉应该那么做。

detailed_translations.english: the act of persuading someone to do something

name: rebel
trans: n. 反叛者，叛徒；叛逆者；反抗权威者 v. 反叛，反抗，造反；抗命；不接受，不听使唤 adj. 反抗的；造反的 n. (Rebel) （美、德、荷、法、俄）勒贝尔（人名）

sentences.english: Voters rebelled against high property taxes.
sentences.chinese: 投票者们反对高额财产税。

detailed_translations.english: to oppose or fight against someone in authority or against an idea or situation which you do not agree with
someone who opposes or fights against people in authority

name: submission
trans: n. 投降；提交（物）；服从；（向法官提出的）意见；谦恭

sentences.english: The deadline for the submission of proposals is May 1st.
sentences.chinese: 呈交提案的最后期限是 5 月 1 日。

sentences.english: Plans were drawn up for submission to the housing council.
sentences.chinese: 计划已起草，要提交给住房委员会。

sentences.english: Submissions will not be accepted after May.
sentences.chinese: 过了5月再提交将不予接受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投降；提交（物）；服从；（向法官提出的）意见；谦恭
detailed_translations.english: when you give or show something to someone in authority, for them to consider or approve

name: epiphyte
trans: n. 附生植物；体表寄生菌

name: foliage
trans: n. 植物；叶子（总称）

sentences.english: dark green foliage
sentences.chinese: 墨绿色的叶子

detailed_translations.english: the leaves of a plant

name: peccary
trans: n. 西貒，矛牙野猪

name: piranha
trans: n. 水虎鱼（产于南美的一种小鱼）

name: resident
trans: n. 居民；（旅店）房客；住院医生，（美国的）高级专科住院实习医生；（美）寄宿制学校学生；（英国派驻半独立国家的）特派代表；驻外特工 adj. 居住的；定居的，常驻的；（鸟、蝴蝶等）非迁徙性的；（计算机程序、文件在存储器中）常驻的；属于……的（幽默用法）

sentences.english: As one local resident put it in May, "By day there is government.
sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.english: A resident said, "I think we should write it down on paper or tell our family members.
sentences.chinese: 一位居民说：“我觉得我们应该把遗嘱写在纸上或者告诉给自己的家人。

sentences.english: Few of her former comrades enjoy this comfort; but, as another resident explained, the authorities like them to live there "to do propaganda and education work".
sentences.chinese: 她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

name: species
trans: n. [生物] 物种；种类 adj. 物种上的

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

name: adaptation
trans: n. 适应；改编；改编本，改写本

sentences.english: Branagh won two awards for his screen adaptation of Shakespeare's Henry the Fifth.
sentences.chinese: 布拉纳因他对莎士比亚的《亨利五世》的荧幕改编而获了两次奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 适应；改编；改编本，改写本
detailed_translations.english: a film or television programme that is based on a book or play

name: cope
trans: vi. 处理；对付；竞争 n. 长袍 n. (Cope)人名；(英)科普；(西)科佩

sentences.english: Sometimes I find it hard to cope.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我觉得很难应付。

sentences.english: He coped quite well as manager while still captaining the team.
sentences.chinese: 他是球队的主教练，同时兼任队长，干得相当好。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in dealing with a difficult problem or situation

name: habitat
trans: n. [生态] 栖息地，产地 n. (Habitat)人名；(德)哈比塔特

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

name: instinctive
trans: adj. 本能的；直觉的；天生的

sentences.english: a mother’s instinctive love
sentences.chinese: 母亲本能的爱

detailed_translations.english: based on instinct and not involving thought

name: thrive
trans: vi. 繁荣，兴旺；茁壮成长

sentences.english: plants that thrive in tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 在热带雨林蓬勃生长的植物

sentences.english: a business which managed to thrive during a recession
sentences.chinese: 在经济萧条时期也能顺利发展的一家企业

detailed_translations.english: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

name: torpor
trans: n. 不活泼；麻木；懒散，迟缓

sentences.english: He had slumped into a state of torpor from which nothing could rouse him.
sentences.chinese: 他陷入了一种麻木状态，什么事都不能唤起他的兴趣。

sentences.english: The sick person gradually falls into a torpor.
sentences.chinese: 这位病人逐渐陷入了萎靡状态中。

detailed_translations.english: Torpor is the state of being completely inactive mentally or physically, for example, because of illness or laziness

name: photosynthesis
trans: n. 光合作用

sentences.english: It has at least one gene necessary for photosynthesis—so far it’s the only animal known with this ability.
sentences.chinese: 它有至少一个基因是光合作用所必需的——到目前为止这是唯一被发现具有此项能力的动物。

sentences.english: The belt of vegetation that crosses Africa below the Sahara is very dark because most of the sunlight is absorbed by plants for photosynthesis.
sentences.chinese: 在撒哈拉沙漠下方，横贯非洲中部的植被带颜色非常深，因为植物由于光合作用吸收了大多数太阳光。

sentences.english: As the ocean warms, it becomes more stratified, with the warmer water remaining at the top where the organisms need to be in order to do photosynthesis.
sentences.chinese: 但是随着海水变暖，它的层次会更加分明，温度更高的海水会停留在表面，而这里正是生物体进行光合作用必需的地方。

detailed_translations.english: the production by a green plant of special substances like sugar that it uses as food, caused by the action of sunlight on  chlorophyll (= the green substance in leaves )

name: phytoplankton
trans: n. [植] 浮游植物（群落）

name: platoon
trans: n. 排，团；一组

sentences.english: I have stationed another platoon on the island.
sentences.chinese: 我已向那个岛派出了又一个排的守军。

sentences.english: That’s hardly an army. It’s not even a platoon.
sentences.chinese: 这根本算不上一个军队，甚至连一个排都算不上。

detailed_translations.english: a small group of soldiers which is part of a  company  and is led by a  lieutenant

name: possession
trans: n. 拥有；财产；领地；自制；着迷

sentences.english: That information is not in our possession.
sentences.chinese: 那则信息不归我们所有。

sentences.english: How did the painting come into your possession (= how did you get it ) ?
sentences.chinese: 这幅画是怎么到你手上的？

sentences.english: The finance company now has possession of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这家金融公司目前拥有这所房子。

sentences.english: We didn’t take possession of (= get and start using ) the car until a few days after the auction.
sentences.chinese: 拍卖会过后几天我们才正式拿到那辆车。

detailed_translations.english: if something is in your possession, you own it, or you have obtained it from somewhere

name: specialized
trans: adj. 专业的；专门的 v. 专攻（specialize的过去分词）；使…专门化；详细说明

name: spectator
trans: n. 观众；旁观者

sentences.english: The match attracted over 40,000 spectators.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛吸引了四万多名观众。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is watching an event or game

name: dictator
trans: n. 独裁者；命令者

sentences.english: the downfall of the hated dictator
sentences.chinese: 遭人痛恨的独裁者的垮台

detailed_translations.english: a ruler who has complete power over a country, especially one whose power has been gained by force

name: diverse
trans: adj. 不同的，相异的；多种多样的，形形色色的

sentences.english: subjects as diverse as pop music and archaeology
sentences.chinese: 像流行音乐和考古学这样各不相同的学科

detailed_translations.english: very different from each other

name: gaucho
trans: n. 加乌乔人（居住于南美大草原上的印第安人和西班牙人的混血种族）

detailed_translations.english: a South American cowboy

name: province
trans: n. 省；领域；职权

sentences.english: Computers were once the exclusive province of scientists and mathematicians.
sentences.chinese: 计算机一度为科学家和数学家专用。

detailed_translations.english: a subject that someone knows a lot about or something that only they are responsible for

name: volcanic
trans: adj. 火山的；猛烈的；易突然发作的 n. 火山岩

sentences.english: black volcanic sand
sentences.chinese: 黑色的火山砂

detailed_translations.english: relating to or caused by a volcano

name: fate
trans: n. 命运 vt. 注定 n. (Fate)人名；(英)费特

sentences.english: I wouldn’t wish such a fate on my worst enemy.
sentences.chinese: 就算是我不共戴天的仇敌，我也不希望他遭遇这样的命运。

detailed_translations.english: the things that happen to someone or something, especially unpleasant things that end their existence or end a particular period

name: fiend
trans: n. 魔鬼；能手；成癖者

sentences.english: A tearful husband repeated calls for help in catching the fiend who battered his wife.
sentences.chinese: 泪流满面的丈夫再三呼吁协助抓住殴打他妻子的那个恶棍。

detailed_translations.english: an evil spirit

name: mail
trans: n. 邮件；邮政，邮递；盔甲 vt. 邮寄；给…穿盔甲 vi. 邮寄；寄出 n. (Mail)人名；(法)马伊

sentences.english: You shouldn’t read other people’s mail.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该看别人的信件。

sentences.english: He found a mountain of mail waiting for him.
sentences.chinese: 他发现有堆积如山的邮件等着他处理。

sentences.english: She promised to forward my mail to my new address (= send it from your old home or office to your new one ) .
sentences.chinese: 她答应把我的邮件转寄到我的新地址。

sentences.english: He gets sacks of fan mail (= letters from people who admire him ) .
sentences.chinese: 他收到成堆仰慕者的来信。

sentences.english: The weekly newsletter is mailed to women all over the country.
sentences.chinese: 每周一期的简报邮寄给全国各地的妇女。

detailed_translations.english: the letters and packages that are delivered to you
to send a letter or package to someone

name: moor
trans: n. 沼泽，荒野；高沼地的草原；猎场 v. 系住；使停泊 n. (Moor) （德、英）穆尔（人名）

sentences.english: Two or three fishing boats were moored alongside the pier.
sentences.chinese: 有两三艘渔船停泊在码头边。

sentences.english: Colliford is higher, right up on the moors.
sentences.chinese: 考里弗德更高，正好在荒野之上。

detailed_translations.english: to fasten a ship or boat to the land or to the bottom of the sea using ropes or an  anchor
A moor is an area of open and usually high land with poor soil that is covered mainly with grass and heather

name: perish
trans: vt. 使麻木；毁坏 vi. 死亡；毁灭；腐烂；枯萎

sentences.english: Hundreds perished when the ship went down.
sentences.chinese: 轮船沉没，数百人罹难。

detailed_translations.english: to die, especially in a terrible or sudden way

name: spoil
trans: vt. 溺爱；糟蹋；破坏；掠夺 vi. 掠夺；变坏；腐败 n. 次品；奖品

sentences.english: The whole park is spoiled by litter.
sentences.chinese: 整个公园环境都给垃圾破坏了。

sentences.english: We didn’t let the incident spoil our day.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有让这件事破坏我们一整天的气氛。

sentences.english: I don’t want to spoil your fun.
sentences.chinese: 我不想扫你的兴。

sentences.english: Why do you always have to spoil everything ?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么老是要把一切都弄糟呢？

detailed_translations.english: to have a bad effect on something so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful etc

name: amendment
trans: n. 修正案；改善；改正

sentences.english: constitutional amendments
sentences.chinese: 宪法修正案

detailed_translations.english: a small change, improvement, or addition that is made to a law or document, or the process of doing this

name: barrier
trans: n. 障碍物，屏障；界线 vt. 把…关入栅栏 n. (Barrier)人名；(法)巴里耶

sentences.english: He advocated the removal of trade barriers.
sentences.chinese: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。

sentences.english: Crowds burst through the barriers and ran onto the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 人群冲破围栏跑进球场。

sentences.english: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 群山构成了两国之间的天然屏障。

detailed_translations.english: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

name: Constitution
trans: n. 宪法；体制；章程；构造；建立，组成；体格

name: freedom
trans: n. 自由，自主；直率 n. (Freedom)人名；(英)弗里德姆

sentences.english: People here like their freedom and privacy.
sentences.chinese: 这里的人喜欢他们所拥有的自由与隐私权。

sentences.english: the rights and freedoms of citizens
sentences.chinese: 公民的权利与自由

sentences.english: the freedom to vote
sentences.chinese: 选举自由

sentences.english: He thinks children have too much freedom these days.
sentences.chinese: 他认为如今的孩子太自由了。

detailed_translations.english: the right to do what you want without being controlled or restricted by anyone

name: right
trans: adj. 正确的；直接的；右方的 vi. 复正；恢复平稳 n. 正确；右边；正义；权利 adv. 正确地；恰当地；彻底地 vt. 纠正 n. (Right)人名；(英)赖特

sentences.english: Yes, that’s the right answer .
sentences.chinese: 对，回答正确。

sentences.english: Is that the right time ?
sentences.chinese: 那个时间对吗？

sentences.english: I got most of the questions right .
sentences.chinese: 大部分问题我都答对了。

sentences.english: His ideas have now been proved right .
sentences.chinese: 他的观点现已证明是对的。

detailed_translations.english: a statement or piece of information that is right is correct and based on true facts
exactly in a particular position or place
used to check if what you have said is correct
exactly in a particular position or place

name: deforestation
trans: n. 毁林，采伐森林，森林开伐，烧林

sentences.english: the deforestation of the tropics
sentences.chinese: 热带森林的毁坏

detailed_translations.english: the cutting or burning down of all the trees in an area

name: highlands
trans: n. 高原地区；山岳地带（highland的复数形式）

name: plantation
trans: n. 栽植；殖民；大农场 adj. 适用于种植园或热带、亚热带国家的

sentences.english: a rubber plantation
sentences.chinese: 橡胶园

detailed_translations.chinese: 适用于种植园或热带、亚热带国家的

name: commonwealth
trans: n. 联邦；共和国；国民整体

sentences.english: ...the Commonwealth of Australia.
sentences.chinese: …澳大利亚联邦。

detailed_translations.english: used in the official names of some countries, groups of countries, or parts of countries

name: tundra
trans: n. [生态] 苔原；[地理] 冻原；冻土地带

sentences.english: Frozen dog dirt stipples the tundra of the golf course.
sentences.chinese: 冻成冰块的狗屎点缀着高尔夫球场的苔原。

sentences.english: The park contains 150 lakes and 450 miles of streams, plus ecosystems ranging from wetlands to pine forests to montane areas to alpine tundra.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家公园包括150个湖泊和450英里河流以及从湿地到松林、从山丘到高山冻原等各种生态系统。

detailed_translations.english: the large flat areas of land in the north of Russia, Canada etc, where it is very cold and there are no trees

name: convention
trans: n. 大会；[法] 惯例；[计] 约定；[法] 协定；习俗

sentences.english: a teachers’ convention
sentences.chinese: 教师大会

sentences.english: the city’s new convention center
sentences.chinese: 该市新建的会议中心

sentences.english: a convention for science fiction fans
sentences.chinese: 科幻小说迷的集会

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting for people who belong to the same profession or organization or who have the same interests

name: diversity
trans: n. 多样性；差异

sentences.english: ...the cultural diversity of Latin America.
sentences.chinese: …拉丁美洲文化的多样性。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of including many different types of people or things

name: merchandise
trans: n. 商品；货物 vt. 买卖；推销 vi. 经商

sentences.english: A range of official Disney merchandise was on sale.
sentences.chinese: 一系列正版的迪士尼商品在出售。

sentences.english: They inspected the merchandise carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他们仔细地检查了商品。

detailed_translations.english: goods that are being sold
to try to sell goods or services using methods such as advertising

name: panel
trans: n. 仪表板；嵌板；座谈小组，全体陪审员 vt. 嵌镶板 n. (Panel) 帕内尔（人名）

sentences.english: A panel of experts has looked at the proposal.
sentences.chinese: 一组专家审核了那项提议。

sentences.english: There will be at least three senior doctors on the panel.
sentences.chinese: 专家小组中至少有三名资深医生。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people with skills or specialist knowledge who have been chosen to give advice or opinions on a particular subject

name: Allies
trans: n. （第二次世界大战时的）同盟国；（第一次世界大战时的）协约国

name: casualty

sentences.english: Any history of bombing must also be a history of civilian casualty, for bombing saves the lives of soldiers only at the expense of other lives.
sentences.chinese: 任何空袭的历史也必定是平民伤亡的历史，因为空袭救了士兵的性命只能以其他人的生命为代价。

sentences.english: The first item always on that was the overnight casualty report from Iraq and Afghanistan, and I would often come and see that had been circled by the president or that he would be reflecting on that.
sentences.chinese: 上面的第一条永远是,这一晚在伊拉克和阿富汗,士兵的伤亡报告，我来的时候会看到那条消息,被布什总统圈了出来,他看着报告会陷入沉思。

name: infantry
trans: n. 步兵；步兵团

sentences.english: an infantry regiment
sentences.chinese: 步兵团

detailed_translations.english: soldiers who fight on foot

name: mission
trans: n. 使命，任务；代表团；布道 vt. 派遣；向……传教

sentences.chinese: 在阵亡之前他奉命执行过200多次军事任务。

sentences.english: US troops taking part in the peacekeeping mission
sentences.chinese: 参与维和任务的美军

sentences.english: a British trade mission to Moscow

detailed_translations.english: an important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft

name: paratrooper
trans: n. 伞兵

name: disaster
trans: n. 灾难，灾祸；不幸

sentences.chinese: 有120人在中国这起最惨烈的空难事故中丧生。

sentences.chinese: 1987年的飓风是英格兰数十年来遭遇的最为严重的自然灾害。

sentences.chinese: 一名登山者从山上滑落，他们的探险活动险些以灾难告终。

sentences.english: The drought could spell disaster for wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 干旱可能会对野生生物造成灾难。

sentences.english: Disaster struckwhen two men were killed during their parachute jumps.
sentences.chinese: 灾难突然降临，两名男子在跳伞过程中丧生。

sentences.english: The peace process was on the brink of disaster .
sentences.chinese: 和平进程到了灾难的边缘。

sentences.english: Luckily the pilot saw the other plane just in time, and a disaster was narrowly averted .
sentences.chinese: 幸好驾驶员及时看到了另一架飞机，侥幸避免了一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden event such as a flood, storm, or accident which causes great damage or suffering

name: drought
trans: n. 干旱；缺乏 n. (Drought)人名；(英)德劳特

sentences.chinese: …过去18年来干旱和饥荒致死达两百万人的一个国家。

trans: adj. 经济的，经济上的；经济学的

sentences.chinese: 经济增长缓慢。

sentences.english: Economic reform is needed.
sentences.chinese: 经济改革势在必行。

sentences.english: In the current economic climate (= conditions ), we must keep costs down.
sentences.chinese: 在当前的经济形势下，我们一定要控制好成本。

detailed_translations.english: relating to trade, in-dustry, and the management of money

sentences.english: the erosion of the coastline
sentences.chinese: 海岸线受到的侵蚀

detailed_translations.english: the process by which rock or soil is gradually destroyed by wind, rain, or the sea

trans: n. 草原；牧草地

sentences.english: ...areas of open grassland.
sentences.chinese: ...开阔的草地区域。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of land covered with wild grass

name: arid
trans: adj. 干旱的；不毛的，[农] 荒芜的

sentences.english: Water from the Great Lakes is pumped to arid regions .
sentences.chinese: 五大湖中的水被输往干旱地区。

name: gust

sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风掠过山谷。

if the wind gusts, it blows strongly with sudden short movements

trans: vt. 吸入；猛吃猛喝 vi. 吸气

sentences.chinese: 吸入氨气是很危险的。

sentences.chinese: 迈拉又点上一支烟，深深地吸了一口。

trans: n. 气象学者

sentences.chinese: 西雅图气象专家表示，这也许是自1990年以来最严重的暴风雪。

sentences.chinese: 在文中，他写道：“一位气象学者注意到，如果这个理论是正确的，那就意味着一只海鸥扇动一下翅膀能够永久地改变天气的进程”。

sentences.english: By e-mail and earphone, he confers with Jack Parrish, chief meteorologist, and they order the NOAA technician to slip a dropsonde into the shoot.
sentences.chinese: 通过电子邮件和耳机，他与首席气象学家杰克·帕里什联络，指挥NOAA的技术人员发射下投式探空仪。

name: respiratory
trans: adj. 呼吸的

sentences.english: respiratory disease

sentences.chinese: 尼罗河三角洲

detailed_translations.chinese: （河流的）三角洲；德耳塔（希腊字母的第四个字）
detailed_translations.english: the fourth letter of the Greek alphabet

sentences.chinese: 在有些地方大沙丘使得靠近海滩很难。

detailed_translations.english: a hill made of sand near the sea or in the desert

trans: n. 王朝，朝代

sentences.chinese: 哈布斯堡王朝在1278至1918年间统治奥地利。

detailed_translations.english: a family of kings or other rulers whose parents, grandparents etc have ruled the country for many years

trans: n. 伊斯兰教 n. (Islam)人名；(阿拉伯、巴基、孟)伊斯兰

sentences.chinese: 他在16岁时皈依了伊斯兰教。

trans: n. 法老；暴君

sentences.chinese: 他们并不像法老、弥诺斯或美索不达米亚君主那样类似上帝的超人。

sentences.chinese: 金字塔式管理体系中的不同层次

sentences.chinese: 不过，要是发生雪崩怎么办呢？

sentences.english: If the value was much lower than one, on the other hand, the avalanche would soon die out.

trans: vi. 下降；下去；下来；遗传；屈尊 vt. 下去；沿…向下

sentences.chinese: 我们的飞机开始下降。

sentences.english: I heard his footsteps descending the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 我听到他下楼的脚步声。

detailed_translations.english: to move from a higher level to a lower one
to move from a higher level to a lower one

trans: adj. 分不清方向或目标的；无判断力的 v. 使……迷惑（disorient 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.chinese: …个人英雄主义行为。

detailed_translations.english: Heroism is great courage and bravery

sentences.chinese: 他的伟大成就在于把所有选手组织成一支团结的队伍。

sentences.chinese: 我们需要学校把学生培养为好公民。

sentences.chinese: 一场特大暴风雨即将到来，市长敦促市民做好准备。

sentences.chinese: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.chinese: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

trans: n. 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权 n. (Heritage)人名；(英)赫里蒂奇

sentences.chinese: 保护民族遗产的重要性

sentences.chinese: 属于我们遗产一部分的漂亮古建筑

sentences.chinese: 迈阿密的西裔美国人社区

sentences.english: Hispanic Studies
sentences.chinese: 西班牙语国家研究

detailed_translations.english: from or relating to countries where Spanish or Portuguese are spoken, especially ones in Latin America

sentences.english: He has not studied mechanics or engineering.
sentences.chinese: 他没有学习过力学或者工程学。

detailed_translations.english: the part of physics that deals with the natural forces that act on moving or stationary objects

name: miniaturization
trans: n. 小型化，微型化

name: receiver
trans: n. （电话）听筒；无线电接收机；（破产公司的）官方接管人；接受者，收受者；购买（或接受）赃物的人；接球手；接受罐，聚集器；机匣

sentences.english: a satellite receiver
sentences.chinese: 卫星信号接收器

sentences.english: She picked up the receiver and dialled his number.
sentences.chinese: 她拿起听筒，拨了他的电话号码。

sentences.english: The business is in the hands of the receivers .
sentences.chinese: 公司现在由破产管理人接管。

detailed_translations.chinese: 电话听筒；接收器；〔破产企业或公司的〕管理人，接管人

name: remote control

sentences.chinese: 每个晶体管至少有三个电极。

sentences.chinese: 晶体管后来成为了一项叫做“计算机”的新发明的基础，我想正在阅读本文的你对于这个应该比较熟悉吧。

sentences.english: When you got a transistor radio, you could walk around with it, and today you can put your whole record collection in your pocket.
sentences.chinese: 而当你使用晶体管收音机时，你可以带着它到处走动，时至今日你可以把你收集的唱片装进口袋里。

sentences.english: ...a homemade radio transmitter.
sentences.chinese: …一台自制的无线电发射机。

detailed_translations.english: equipment that sends out radio or television signals

name: electricity

sentences.chinese: 那个农场非常偏远，但有电力供应。

detailed_translations.english: the power that is carried by wires, cables etc, and is used to provide light or heat, to make machines work etc

name: engineer

sentences.chinese: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

sentences.chinese: 老师提供了几种不同的材料让孩子们试验。

name: invention

sentences.chinese: 电脑的发明使商界发生了根本变化。

sentences.english: They subsequently admitted that the story was pure invention.
sentences.chinese: 他们后来承认他们说的纯属虚构。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明，创造；捏造， 假话

name: patent

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

sentences.english: Under his visionary leadership, the city prospered.
sentences.chinese: 在他富有远见的领导下，这座城市蓬勃发展。

name: address

detailed_translations.english: if you address a problem, you start trying to solve it

sentences.chinese: 这名女演员现在致力于儿童慈善工作。

sentences.chinese: 战争给该地区造成巨大的破坏以及生命的丧失。

sentences.chinese: 激励人心的音乐

sentences.english: King was a great orator and an inspiring leader.
sentences.chinese: 金是伟大的演说家和鼓舞人心的领袖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鼓舞人心的；灌输的；启发灵感的

detailed_translations.chinese: 鼓舞；激发；使感悟（inspire的ing形式）

name: proposition

sentences.english: He telephoned Stuart with a proposition.
sentences.chinese: 他打电话给斯图尔特提了个建议。

sentences.english: I’ve got a proposition to put to you.

name: secession

sentences.chinese: 赞成独立的一票

name: don

sentences.chinese: 他穿戴上他的披风和手套。

sentences.english: Please extinguish all cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 请把香烟都熄灭了。

sentences.english: Firemen were called to extinguish the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 有人打电话叫消防队员来扑灭大火。

sentences.english: All hope was almost extinguished.
sentences.chinese: 所有的希望都快要破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to make a fire or light stop burning or shining

name: grueling
trans: adj. 使人精疲力尽的；艰辛的；让人受不了的

sentences.english: Yet he went on to win the Tour de France, one of the most grueling sports events there is, a record 7 times.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他却在环法自行车赛获胜，并破了连续7次夺冠的记录，要知道，这可是最折磨人的一项体育项目啊。

detailed_translations.english: Gruel is a food made by boiling oats with water or milk

name: ignite
trans: vt. 点燃；使燃烧；使激动 vi. 点火；燃烧

sentences.english: The bombs ignited a fire which destroyed some 60 houses.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹引起了一场火灾，烧毁了大约六十间房屋。

detailed_translations.english: When you ignite something or when it ignites, it starts burning or explodes
to start burning, or to make something start burning

name: maneuver
trans: n. [军] 机动；演习；策略；调遣 vi. [军] 机动；演习；调遣；用计谋 vt. [军] 机动；演习；用计；调遣

sentences.english: The chopper shot upward in a manoeuver matched by the other pilot.
sentences.chinese: 这架直升飞机向上冲去，另一架飞机也以相同的移动方向冲了上去。

sentences.english: The president has tried to manoeuver the campaign away from himself.
sentences.chinese: 总统试图操控该活动，使其远离自身。

sentences.english: That will allow them to manoeuvre the satellite into the shuttle's cargo bay.
sentences.chinese: 那将使得他们能把人造卫星移入飞船的货物舱。

detailed_translations.english: a skilful or careful movement that you make, for example in order to avoid something or go through a narrow space
to move or turn skilfully or to move or turn something skilfully, especially something large and heavy

name: plummet
trans: v. 陡直落下，快速落下；（价值、数量等）骤然下跌 n. 骤降；铅垂，铅垂线

sentences.english: House prices have plummeted down.
sentences.chinese: 房价已经暴跌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 垂直落下；（价格、水平等）骤然下跌
detailed_translations.english: to suddenly and quickly decrease in value or amount

name: dismount
trans: v. 下（马、车等）；将（某物）从支架上移开（或卸下）；取出（磁盘） n. （体操动作的）下法，完成

name: meandering
trans: adj. 曲折的；聊天的；漫步的 n. 漫步；漫谈；[建] 曲径 v. 漫步（meander的ing形式）

name: posture
trans: n. 姿势；态度；情形 vi. 摆姿势 vt. 作…的姿势

sentences.english: her upright posture
sentences.chinese: 她笔挺的姿势

detailed_translations.english: the way you position your body when sitting or standing

name: trot
trans: n. （人）慢跑；马小跑的步态；小跑的马蹄声；刚学步的小孩；老太婆；腹泻；（学生作弊用的）译文对照本 vi. （马）小跑；（人）慢跑；快步走 vt. 使小跑；使快步走

sentences.english: Alan took the reins and the small horse started trotting.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦抓住缰绳，小马开始慢跑起来。

sentences.english: Our horses slowed to a trot.
sentences.chinese: 我们的马减速慢跑。

sentences.english: She broke into a trot (= started running slowly ) and hurried on ahead of us.
sentences.chinese: 她突然小跑起来，赶到我们前头。

detailed_translations.english: if a horse trots, it moves fairly quickly with each front leg moving at the same time as the opposite back leg
the movement of a horse at trotting speed

name: appendage
trans: n. 附加物；下属；[动][解剖] 附器（如植物的枝叶和动物的腿尾）

sentences.english: Upon marriage, a woman automatically lost most of her legal rights and became an appendage of her husband.
sentences.chinese: 结婚后，妇女自动失去自己大部分的法律权利，成为丈夫的附属品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 附加物；下属；[动][解剖] 附器（如植物的枝叶和动物的腿尾）
detailed_translations.english: something that is connected to a larger or more important thing

name: cartilage
trans: n. 软骨

sentences.english: Andre Agassi has pulled out of next week's Grand Slam Cup after tearing a cartilage in his chest.
sentences.chinese: 安德烈·阿加西胸部软骨拉伤后已退出了下周的大满贯赛事。

detailed_translations.english: a strong substance that can bend, which is around the joints in your body and in your outer ear

name: ligament
trans: n. 韧带；纽带，系带

sentences.english: He tore a ligament in his left knee.
sentences.chinese: 他拉伤了左膝韧带。

sentences.english: damaged ankle ligaments
sentences.chinese: 受伤的踝关节韧带

detailed_translations.english: a band of strong material in your body, similar to muscle, that joins bones or holds an organ in its place

name: tendon
trans: n. [解剖] 腱 n. (Tendon)人名；(法)唐东

sentences.english: ...a torn tendon in his right shoulder.
sentences.chinese: …他右肩一根被拉伤的腱。

detailed_translations.english: a thick strong string-like part of your body that connects a muscle to a bone

name: vertebrate
trans: n. 脊椎动物 adj. 脊椎动物（有关）的；有脊椎的

sentences.english: Because these cells are among the largest in the vertebrate brain, they were the first neurons to be identified.
sentences.chinese: 由于这些细胞是脊椎动物大脑中最大的细胞，它们是最早被识别出来的神经元。

sentences.english: Zoonoses are defined by the WHO as “Any disease or infection which is naturally transmissible from vertebrate animals to man".
sentences.chinese: 世界卫生组织将人畜共患病定义为“任何自然地从脊椎动物传播到人类的疾病或传染病”。

detailed_translations.english: a living creature that has a backbone

name: acclimate
trans: vi. 服水土；适应新环境 vt. 使适应；使服水土

sentences.english: Several things can be done to help the snake acclimate.
sentences.chinese: 可以通过几件事帮助这些蛇去适应新环境。

sentences.english: Some earth plants that I will try to acclimate to the moon.
sentences.chinese: 我将设法使一些地球植物适应月球的环境。

detailed_translations.english: Acclimate means the same as

name: footpath
trans: n. 人行道；小路；小径

sentences.english: He said he had just picked up the druken man from the footpath and did not know him from Adam.
sentences.chinese: 他说他只是把这个倒在人行道上的醉汉扶了起来，他根本不认识他。

sentences.english: The sun was shining gloriously, so Karen and the old lady went along the footpath through the corn, where it was rather dusty.
sentences.chinese: 那天艳阳高照，凯伦和老妇人沿着穿过玉米地的小路去教堂，一路上灰尘漫天。

detailed_translations.english: a narrow path for people to walk along, especially in the country

name: insurmountable
trans: adj. 不能克服的；不能超越的；难以对付的

sentences.english: The language difference proved an insurmountable barrier.
sentences.chinese: 语言差异是难以克服的障碍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能克服的；不能超越的；难以对付的
detailed_translations.english: an insurmountable difficulty or problem is too large or difficult to deal with

name: summit
trans: n. 顶点；最高级会议；最高阶层 adj. 最高级的；政府首脑的

sentences.english: the European summit
sentences.chinese: 欧洲首脑会议

sentences.english: The two presidents agreed to hold a summit in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 两位总统商定在春天举行一次首脑会议。

sentences.english: a five-nation summit meeting
sentences.chinese: 五国峰会

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高点， 峰顶； 最高级会议
detailed_translations.english: an important meeting or set of meetings between the leaders of several governments

name: traverse
trans: v. 穿过；来回移动；反驳；阻挠；详细研究；旋转 n. 穿过；横挡；（大炮等的）横转装置；测量导线；（壕沟的）土护墙 adj. 横贯的 n. (Traverse) （加、美、法、英）特拉韦尔斯（人名）

sentences.english: two minutes to traverse the park
sentences.chinese: 两分钟横穿公园

detailed_translations.english: a sideways movement across a very steep slope in mountain-climbing

detailed_translations.chinese: 穿过；反对；详细研究；在…来回移动
detailed_translations.english: to move across, over, or through something, especially an area of land or water

name: animated
trans: v. （使）生机勃勃；把……制成动画片；（使）有生命；鼓励，激励（animate 的过去式及过去分词） adj. 生机勃勃的；活跃的；热烈的；栩栩如生的；动画的；活动的

sentences.english: Disney has returned to what it does best: making full-length animated feature films.
sentences.chinese: 迪斯尼电影公司回到他们最拿手的事情：制作长篇动画故事片。

detailed_translations.english: showing a lot of interest and energy

name: anime
trans: n. 日本动漫；芳香树脂

name: exaggerated
trans: adj. 夸张的，言过其实的 v. 夸张，夸大（exaggerate的过去式）

name: illustration
trans: n. 说明；插图；例证；图解

sentences.english: The book contains 62 pages of illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 这本书有62页插图。

detailed_translations.english: a picture in a book, article etc, especially one that helps you to understand it

name: manga
trans: n. 日本漫画 n. (Manga)人名；(法)芒加；(土、西、葡、罗、喀、塞拉、尼日尔)曼加

name: Celtic
trans: adj. 凯尔特人的；凯尔特语的 n. 凯尔特语（等于Keltic）

name: prank
trans: n. 恶作剧，开玩笑；戏谑 vt. 装饰；打扮 vi. 炫耀自己；胡闹

sentences.english: a childish prank
sentences.chinese: 孩子气的恶作剧

detailed_translations.english: a trick, especially one which is played on someone to make them look silly
to dress or decorate showily or gaudily

name: prediction
trans: n. 预报；预言

sentences.english: The data can be used to make useful economic predictions .
sentences.chinese: 这些数据可用于进行有用的经济预测。

detailed_translations.english: a statement about what you think is going to happen, or the act of making this statement

name: supernatural
trans: adj. 超自然的；神奇的，不可思议的 n. 超自然现象；不可思议的事

sentences.english: supernatural powers
sentences.chinese: 超自然力量

sentences.english: He writes short stories with a touch of the supernatural.
sentences.chinese: 他写带点儿超自然物的短篇故事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 超自然的；神奇的，不可思议的
detailed_translations.english: impossible to explain by natural causes, and therefore seeming to involve the powers of gods or magic

detailed_translations.chinese: 超自然现象；不可思议的事
detailed_translations.english: The supernatural is things that are supernatural

name: tradition
trans: n. 惯例，传统；传说

sentences.english: the traditions of South East Asia
sentences.chinese: 东南亚的传统

sentences.english: the tradition that the eldest son inherits the property
sentences.chinese: 长子继承家产的传统

sentences.english: By tradition, it’s the bride’s parents who pay for the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 根据传统习俗，婚礼的费用由新娘的父母承担。

detailed_translations.english: a belief, custom, or way of doing something that has existed for a long time, or these beliefs, customs etc in general

name: underworld
trans: n. 黑社会；地狱；下层社会；尘世

sentences.english: New York’s criminal underworld
sentences.chinese: 纽约的黑社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 黑社会；地狱；下层社会；尘世
detailed_translations.english: the criminals in a particular place and the criminal activities they are involved in

name: browser
trans: n. [计] 浏览器；吃嫩叶的动物；浏览书本的人

sentences.english: a Web browser
sentences.chinese: 网页浏览器

detailed_translations.chinese: [计] 浏览器；吃嫩叶的动物；浏览书本的人
detailed_translations.english: a computer program that finds information on the Internet and shows it on your computer screen

name: Internet
trans: n. 因特网

sentences.english: Do you have access to the Internet?
sentences.chinese: 你上得了网吗？

detailed_translations.english: a computer system that allows millions of computer users around the world to exchange information

name: modem
trans: n. 调制解调器（等于modulator-demodulator）

sentences.english: He sent his work to his publishers by modem.
sentences.chinese: 他通过调制解调器把作品发给他的出版商。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of electronic equipment that allows information from one computer to be sent along telephone wires to another computer

name: search engine
trans: 搜索引擎

name: URL
trans: abbr. 全球资源定位器（Uniform Resource Locator）

name: competition
trans: n. 竞争；比赛，竞赛

sentences.english: Going to trade fairs is an ideal opportunity to size up the competition .
sentences.chinese: 参加商品交易会是估量竞争规模的理想机会。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

name: ecosystem
trans: n. 生态系统

sentences.english: ...the forest ecosystem.
sentences.chinese: …森林生态系统。

detailed_translations.english: all the animals and plants in a particular area, and the way in which they are related to each other and to their environment

name: native
trans: adj. 本国的；土著的；天然的；与生俱来的；天赋的 n. 本地人；土产；当地居民

sentences.english: Singapore has many native species of palm.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡有很多土生的棕榈树种。

sentences.english: You can always tell the difference between the tourists and the natives.
sentences.chinese: 游客与当地人之间的区别一望即知。

detailed_translations.english: growing, living, produced etc in one particular place
someone who lives in a place all the time or has lived there a long time

name: python
trans: n. 巨蟒；大蟒 n. （法）皮东（人名）

sentences.english: SITTBOW, Cambodia (Reuters) - Cambodians are flocking to see a three-year-old boy they believe was the son of a dragon in a former life because his best friend is a four-meter-long python.
sentences.chinese: 柬埔寨，路透社-柬埔寨人都成群结队去观看一个三岁的小男孩，由于小男孩最好的朋友是一条四米长的巨蟒，人们认为小孩前生是一条龙的儿子。

sentences.english: Fat does a heart good—at least if you're a python, a new study says.
sentences.chinese: 一项新研究得出的结论是，脂肪对心脏是有好处的——如果你是一条巨蟒的话。

detailed_translations.english: a large tropical snake that kills animals for food by winding itself around them and crushing them

name: reproduce
trans: vt. 复制；再生；生殖；使…在脑海中重现 vi. 复制；繁殖

sentences.english: Klimt’s artwork is reproduced in this exquisite book.
sentences.chinese: 这本精美的书里翻印了克里木特的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: to make a photograph or printed copy of something

name: culminate
trans: vi. 到绝顶；达到高潮；达到顶点 vt. 使结束；使达到高潮

sentences.english: All aspects of the printers system performance culminate at this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上的所有方面的印表机系统的性能达到高潮。

sentences.english: We are approaching a Galactic wave right now and it will culminate in the Event.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在即将迎接一道银河能量波，而事件会在这道能量波达到高潮时发生。

name: hologram
trans: n. [激光] 全息图；全息摄影，全息照相

sentences.english: No one knows what it would mean for us if we really do live in a hologram, yet theorists have good reasons to believe that many aspects of the holographic principle are true.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们确实生活在一张全息图中，没人知道这对我们究竟意味着什么。 但理论学家有很好的理由相信全息原理的很多方面是真实的。

detailed_translations.chinese: [激光] 全息图；全息摄影，全息照相
detailed_translations.english: a kind of photograph made with a  laser  that looks as if it is not flat when you look at it from an angle

name: humanoid
trans: adj. 像人的 n. 类人动物

name: levitate
trans: vt. 使轻轻浮起；使飘浮空中 vi. 轻轻浮起；飘浮空中

name: simulation
trans: n. 仿真；模拟；模仿；假装

sentences.english: a computer simulation used to train airline pilots
sentences.chinese: 用于训练航空公司飞行员的电脑模拟程序

detailed_translations.english: the activity of producing conditions which are similar to real ones, especially in order to test something, or the conditions that are produced

name: tendril
trans: n. 卷须；蔓；卷须状物

name: boycott
trans: v. 联合抵制；拒绝购买；拒绝参加 n. 联合抵制 n. (Boycott) 博伊科特（人名）

sentences.english: We boycott all products tested on animals.
sentences.chinese: 我们抵制所有拿动物做试验的产品。

sentences.english: They are now trying to organize a boycott.
sentences.chinese: 他们正试图组织一场抵制行动。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to buy something, use something, or take part in something as a way of protesting
an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted

name: decline
trans: n. 下降；衰退；斜面 vi. 下降；衰落；谢绝 vt. 谢绝；婉拒

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

name: legacy
trans: n. 遗赠，遗产

sentences.english: She received a small legacy from her aunt.
sentences.chinese: 她从姨妈那里继承了一小笔遗产。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产，遗赠；先人(或过去)留下的东西
detailed_translations.english: money or property that you receive from someone after they die

name: monarchy
trans: n. 君主政体；君主国；君主政治

sentences.english: the abolition of the monarchy
sentences.chinese: 君主制的废除

detailed_translations.chinese: 君主政体；君主国；君主政治
detailed_translations.english: the system in which a country is ruled by a king or queen

name: treaty
trans: n. 条约，协议；谈判

sentences.english: Both sides have agreed to sign the treaty .
sentences.chinese: 双方都同意签署该条约。

sentences.english: The peace treaty ends nearly four years of violence.
sentences.chinese: 该和平条约结束了将近四年的暴力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 条约， 协议， 协定
detailed_translations.english: a formal written agreement between two or more countries or governments

name: tuberculosis
trans: n. 肺结核；结核病

sentences.english: She was infected with tuberculosis.
sentences.chinese: 她被传染上了肺结核。

sentences.english: With that, he handed me some papers and the address of a tuberculosis specialist; I was to go see him and report back.
sentences.chinese: 他边说边把几张纸和一个肺结核病专家的住址塞到我手里，要我去见那个专家并回报结果。

detailed_translations.english: a serious infectious disease that affects many parts of your body, especially your lungs

name: adapt
trans: vt. 使适应；改编 vi. 适应

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

name: conservation
trans: n. 保存，保持；保护

sentences.english: wildlife conservation
sentences.chinese: 野生生物保护

sentences.english: a local conservation group
sentences.chinese: 当地的一个环境保护团体

detailed_translations.english: the protection of natural things such as animals, plants, forests etc, to prevent them from being spoiled or destroyed

name: decoy
trans: n. 诱饵；诱骗 vt. 诱骗 vi. 被诱

sentences.english: Officer Langley acted as a decoy to catch the rapist.
sentences.chinese: 警员兰利充当诱饵来抓捕那名强奸犯。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is used to trick someone into going somewhere or doing something, so that you can catch them, attack them etc

name: scavenger
trans: n. 食腐动物；清道夫；[助剂] 清除剂；拾荒者

sentences.english: He struck at one with his knife lashed to the end of an oar and watched the scavenger sliding down into deep water.

sentences.english: I should assign you your share of labor, and compel you to accomplish it.
sentences.chinese: 我要把属于你的那份劳动分配给你，并且强迫你完成它。

sentences.english: For the happiness of human labor, this is how magnificent cause, this goal is how great!
sentences.chinese: 为人类的幸福而劳动，这是多么壮丽的事业，这个目标有多么伟大！

name: penance
trans: n. 忏悔；苦修；苦差事 v. 使忏悔；使苦修

sentences.chinese: 在学医和进神学院之间我犹豫了很久。

sentences.english: Examining the influence of the sports factors on the step exponent of colleges students with the experiment method, questionnaire survey method and Mathematical Statistics method.
sentences.chinese: 采用实验法、问卷调查法和数理统计法，观察运动因素对大学生台阶指数的影响。

sentences.chinese: 恶意用户可以使用这个信息来侦察您的组织机构的名计划，并攻击关键基本设施服务。

sentences.chinese: 恶意用户可以行使这个信息来侦察您的构造机构的名筹划，并进攻关键根本办法做事。

name: chatelaine

sentences.english: She loved everything about him -- his personality, his humor, the way he dressed.
sentences.chinese: 她爱他的一切——他的性格，他的幽默，还有他的衣着打扮。

detailed_translations.english: remarks, jokes etc that are vulgar deal with sex in a very rude and offensive way

sentences.chinese: 我真不敢相信，他竟胆敢还向我要钱！

sentences.chinese: 我们必须更仔细地安排开支。

sentences.english: This scheme enables you to budget the cost through fixed monthly payments.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划可以让你把费用分摊在每个月里等额偿还。

sentences.english: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agents from $240.
sentences.chinese: 起价$240的廉价机票可从一些经济旅行社那里买到。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully plan and control how much money you spend and what you will buy with it

detailed_translations.chinese: 低廉的， 收费公道的
detailed_translations.english: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply
the money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent

name: funding
trans: n. 提供资金；用发行长期债券的方法来收回短期债券 v. 提供资金；积存（fund的ing形式）

sentences.english: They hope for government funding for the programme.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望得到政府为这一计划提供的资金。

detailed_translations.chinese: 基金， 资金； 提供资金
detailed_translations.english: Funding is money which a government or organization provides for a particular purpose

name: petition
trans: n. 请愿；请愿书；祈求；[法] 诉状 vi. 请愿；请求 vt. 请愿；请求；恳求

sentences.english: Local residents have drawn up a petition to protest the hospital closure.
sentences.chinese: 当地居民已草拟了一份请愿书，抗议关闭医院。

sentences.english: Villagers petitioned the local authority to provide better bus services.
sentences.chinese: 村民请愿要求地方当局提供更好的公共汽车服务。

detailed_translations.english: a written request signed by a lot of people, asking someone in authority to do something or change something
to ask the government or an organization to do something by sending them a petition

name: protest
trans: n. 抗议，反对；（多来自公证人）拒付证书 v. 抗议，反对；坚决表示，断言；拒付

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

name: signature
trans: n. 署名；签名；信号

sentences.english: Her signature is totally illegible (= cannot be read ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的签字完全无法辨认。

sentences.english: The school collected 4,000 signatures for the petition.
sentences.chinese: 学校为这份请愿书收集到了四千个签名。

sentences.english: The Ukrainians put their signatures to the Lisbon Protocol.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰签署了《里斯本协议》。

sentences.english: Someone’s forged my signature (= made an illegal copy of my name to deceive people ) on this letter.
sentences.chinese: 有人在这封信中伪造了我的签名。

sentences.english: Each child must obtain the signature of his or her parents.
sentences.chinese: 每个小孩都必须得到父母的签字。

detailed_translations.english: your name written in the way you usually write it, for example at the end of a letter, or on a cheque etc, to show that you have written it

name: creativity
trans: n. 创造力；创造性

sentences.english: artistic creativity
sentences.chinese: 艺术创造力

sentences.english: Teachers have been attacked for stifling creativity in their pupils.
sentences.chinese: 教师被批评压抑了学生的创造力。

sentences.english: Editors complain about the lack of creativity in the ideas put to them.
sentences.chinese: 编辑们抱怨说交给他们的选题缺乏创意。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to use your imagination to produce new ideas, make things etc

name: distinctive
trans: adj. 独特的，有特色的；与众不同的

sentences.english: a rock band with a distinctive sound
sentences.chinese: 音色独特的摇滚乐队

detailed_translations.english: having a special quality, character, or appearance that is different and easy to recognize

name: empower
trans: vt. 授权，允许；使能够

sentences.english: The Voting Rights Act was needed to empower minority groups.
sentences.chinese: 《选举权法案》对于赋予少数民族自主权是必不可少的。

detailed_translations.english: to give a person or organization the legal right to do something

name: innovation
trans: n. 创新，革新；新方法

sentences.english: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
sentences.chinese: 公司要想保持竞争力，就必须鼓励革新。

sentences.english: recent innovations in English teaching
sentences.chinese: 英语教学的新创举

detailed_translations.english: the introduction of new ideas or methods

name: racism
trans: n. 种族主义，种族歧视；人种偏见

sentences.english: The government has promised to continue the fight against racism.
sentences.chinese: 政府已承诺继续打击种族歧视。

sentences.english: the problem of racism in schools
sentences.chinese: 学校里的种族歧视问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 种族主义，种族歧视；人种偏见
detailed_translations.english: unfair treatment of people, or violence against them, because they belong to a different race from your own

name: acknowledge
trans: vt. 承认；答谢；报偿；告知已收到

sentences.english: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.english: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
sentences.chinese: 收到此信后请告知，不胜感谢。

detailed_translations.english: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

name: complex
trans: adj. 复杂的；合成的 n. 复合体；综合设施

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: molecule
trans: n. [化学] 分子；微小颗粒，微粒

sentences.english: The molecules of oxygen gas contain just two atoms.
sentences.chinese: 氧分子中只有两个原子。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest unit into which any substance can be divided without losing its own chemical nature, usually consisting of two or more atoms

name: persevere
trans: vi. 坚持；不屈不挠；固执己见（在辩论中）

sentences.english: It can be tricky at first, but persevere.
sentences.chinese: 一开始会有些棘手，不过要坚持。

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚持；不屈不挠；固执己见（在辩论中）
detailed_translations.english: to continue trying to do something in a very determined way in spite of difficulties – use this to show approval

name: theory
trans: n. 理论；原理；学说；推测

sentences.english: Freudian theory has had a great influence on psychology.
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德理论对心理学产生过巨大影响。

detailed_translations.english: an idea or set of ideas that is intended to explain something about life or the world, especially an idea that has not yet been proved to be true

name: mosque
trans: n. 清真寺

sentences.english: Would you go to church or the synagogue or the mosque?
sentences.chinese: 你会去教堂，犹太教会，或者清真寺吗？

sentences.english: If there is to be a new city church, they argue, then why not a mosque?
sentences.chinese: 他们置疑说，如果要修建一个新的城市教堂为什么不能是座清真寺呢？

sentences.english: Tell the congregation of a church or mosque that existence is too vulgar an attribute to fasten onto their God, and they will brand you an atheist.
sentences.chinese: 告诉教堂或清真寺的会众们，存在，是强加在他们的上帝身上的一种过于庸俗的属性，他们将会指责你为无神论者。

detailed_translations.english: a building in which Muslims worship

name: raid
trans: n. 袭击；突袭；搜捕；抢劫 vi. 突袭 vt. 袭击，突袭 n. (Raid)人名；(阿拉伯)拉伊德

sentences.english: a bombing raid
sentences.chinese: 轰炸

sentences.english: an air raid warning siren
sentences.chinese: 空袭警报

detailed_translations.chinese: 袭击； 突入查抄， 突入搜捕； 劫掠
detailed_translations.english: a short attack on a place by soldiers, planes, or ships, intended to cause damage but not take control

name: sultan
trans: n. 苏丹（某些伊斯兰国家统治者的称号）

sentences.english: Chief of state and government is the hereditary sultan (Qaboos of Oman), who appoints a cabinet to assist him.
sentences.chinese: 国家元首和政府是世袭的苏丹(阿曼? 卡布斯)，他任命内阁来协助他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 苏丹（某些伊斯兰国家统治者的称号）
detailed_translations.english: a ruler in some Islamic countries

name: truce
trans: n. 停战；休战；休战协定 vt. 以休战结束；停止争执 vi. 停战 n. (Truce)人名；(英)特鲁斯

sentences.english: They agreed to call a truce .
sentences.chinese: 他们同意宣布休战。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement between enemies to stop fighting or arguing for a short time, or the period for which this is arranged

name: virtuous
trans: adj. 善良的；有道德的；贞洁的；正直的；有效力的

sentences.english: a virtuous man
sentences.chinese: 品行端正的男子

sentences.english: Sue considered herself very virtuous because she neither drank nor smoked.
sentences.chinese: 休认为自己品行非常端正，因为她既不喝酒也不抽烟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 善良的；有道德的；贞洁的；正直的；有效力的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a very honest and moral way

name: balance
trans: n. 平衡；余额；匀称 vt. 使平衡；结算；使相称 vi. 保持平衡；相称；抵销 n. (Balance)人名；(西)巴兰塞

sentences.english: She balanced the cup on her knee.
sentences.chinese: 她把杯子在膝盖上放稳。

detailed_translations.english: to put your body or sth else into a position where it is steady and does not fall
an instrument for weighing things, with two dishes that hang from a bar

name: exhausted
trans: adj. 筋疲力尽的，疲惫不堪的；耗尽的，枯竭的 v. 使……精疲力尽；耗尽，用尽；详尽讨论（exhaust 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: You look absolutely exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 你看上去一副疲惫不堪的样子。

sentences.english: Don't exhaust him.
sentences.chinese: 别让他精疲力竭了。

detailed_translations.english: extremely tired

detailed_translations.chinese: 耗尽；用尽；使…精疲力尽（exhaust的过去式）
detailed_translations.english: If something exhausts you, it makes you so tired, either physically or mentally, that you have no energy left

name: gallop
trans: n. 疾驰；飞奔 vi. 飞驰；急速进行；急急忙忙地说 vt. 使飞跑；迅速运输 n. (Gallop)人名；(英)盖洛普

sentences.english: I was forced to attempt a gallop.
sentences.chinese: 我被迫尝试一次骑马疾驰。

detailed_translations.english: a very fast speed

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞驰；急速进行；急急忙忙地说
detailed_translations.english: if a horse gallops, it moves very fast with all its feet leaving the ground together

name: navigate
trans: v. 导航；航行，驾驶；找到正确的应对方法；（在互联网上）浏览；（艰难地）走过；（尤指穿过人群）带人找路

sentences.english: The river is too dangerous to navigate.
sentences.chinese: 这河道太危险，不适宜航行。

detailed_translations.english: to sail along a river or other area of water

name: extinct
trans: adj. 灭绝的，绝种的；熄灭的 vt. 使熄灭

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

name: hatchery
trans: n. 孵卵处，孵化场

sentences.english: Running along the brook, down to the hatchery, what heavenly joy this was when school was over!
sentences.chinese: 放学后，有什么比沿着小溪跑到孵卵处更能给人如在天堂般的快乐！

detailed_translations.english: A hatchery is a place where people control the hatching of eggs, especially fish eggs

name: migrate
trans: vi. 移动；随季节而移居；移往 vt. 使移居；使移植

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: reservoir
trans: n. 水库；蓄水池

sentences.english: All these earthquakes happened when the water level in Zipingpu reservoir was low.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些地震都发生在紫坪铺水库水位很低的时候。

detailed_translations.english: a lake, especially an artificial one, where water is stored before it is supplied to people’s houses

name: spawn
trans: v. 产卵；酿成，造成；大量生产；（人）生（孩子，多指不想要的孩子） n. 卵；菌丝；产物

sentences.english: ...her passion for collecting frog spawn.
sentences.chinese: ...她对采蛙卵的热爱。

detailed_translations.english: the eggs of a fish or  frog  laid together in a soft mass

detailed_translations.chinese: 产卵；酿成，造成；大量生产
detailed_translations.english: to make a series of things happen or start to exist

name: glyph
trans: n. 字形；图象字符；纵沟纹

name: hieroglyph
trans: n. 象形文字；图画文字；秘密符号

sentences.english: Initially the patterns I used were hieroglyph like symbols.
sentences.chinese: 我所采用的图案是类似符号的象形文字。

sentences.english: In the Late Period, the hieroglyph of the bird was used to represent this deity directly.
sentences.chinese: 在后来的时期内，鸟的象形文字直接用来表现神。

sentences.english: Initially the patterns I used were hieroglyph like symbols. After a holiday in the Maldives the "face" patterns developed. The local fishes gave me endless inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 我所采用的图案是类似符号的象形文字。在马尔代夫度假后，这些“脸”的图形开始发展。那里的鱼类给了我无穷无尽的灵感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 象形文字, 图画文字
detailed_translations.english: a picture or symbol used to represent a word or part of a word, especially in the ancient Egyptian writing system

name: logogram
trans: n. 简写；速记用略字；标记

name: phonogram
trans: n. 音标符号；录音片；语音图；形声字

name: pictographic
trans: adj. 象形文字的，绘画文字的

name: scribe
trans: n. 抄写员；作家；划线器 vt. 写下，记下；用划线器划 vi. 写下，记下；担任抄写员 n. (Scribe)人名；(法)斯克里布

sentences.english: Might I your scribe and your confessor be.
sentences.chinese: 我可以你和你的忏悔神父是抄写员。

sentences.english: I stepped out of his office and was brought to a small window near the exit, behind which sat a scribe who I knew must be a prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 我走出他的办公室，被带到监狱出口处的一个小窗户边。窗后坐着一个抄写员，我知道他肯定是个囚徒。

detailed_translations.english: someone in the past whose job was to make written copies of official documents

name: defendant
trans: n. 被告（人） adj. 防御的，防守的

sentences.english: We find the defendant not guilty.
sentences.chinese: 我们裁定被告无罪。

detailed_translations.english: the person in a court of law who has been  accused  of doing something illegal

name: evidence
trans: n. 证据，证明；迹象；明显 vt. 证明

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

name: prosecution
trans: n. 起诉，检举；进行；经营

sentences.english: a criminal prosecution
sentences.chinese: 刑事诉讼

sentences.english: The evidence is not sufficient to bring a prosecution against him.
sentences.chinese: 现有证据不足以对他提出起诉。

detailed_translations.english: when a charge is made against someone for a crime, or when someone is judged for a crime in a court of law

name: testify
trans: vt. 证明，证实；作证 vi. 作证；证明

sentences.english: Mr Molto has agreed to testify at the trial.
sentences.chinese: 莫尔托先生已经同意出庭作证。

sentences.english: Can you testify that you saw the defendant at the scene of the crime?
sentences.chinese: 你能作证你看到被告在犯罪现场吗？

detailed_translations.english: to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law
to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law

name: verdict
trans: n. 结论；裁定

sentences.english: The verdict was ‘not guilty’.
sentences.chinese: 裁决为“无罪”。

detailed_translations.english: an official decision made in a court of law, especially about whether someone is guilty of a crime or how a death happened

name: witness
trans: n. 证人；目击者；证据 vt. 目击；证明；为…作证 vi. 作证人 n. (Witness)人名；(津)威特尼斯

sentences.english: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.
sentences.chinese: 警方呼吁目击者站出来。

sentences.english: an eye witness (= someone who sees an event ) to the robbery
sentences.chinese: 抢劫案的一名目击者

detailed_translations.english: someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 目击； 为…作证， 证明
detailed_translations.english: used to introduce an example that proves something you have just mentioned

name: certification
trans: n. 证明，鉴定； 出具课程结业证书，颁发证书

sentences.english: We successfully completed the certification for open water diving.
sentences.chinese: 我们成功地拿到了开放水域潜水证书。

detailed_translations.english: an official document that says that someone is allowed to do a certain job, that something is of good quality etc

name: compressed
trans: adj. （被）压缩的；扁的 v. （被）压紧，压缩； 精简，浓缩；压缩（文件等）；压缩声音信号的动态范围（compress 的过去式和过去分词）

name: hazard
trans: n. 危险，风险；冒险的事；机会；双骰子游戏；（高尔夫球的）球场障碍；（庭院网球用语）可得分区域；（台球）落入袋中 v. 大胆猜测；冒……的危险，使遭受危险；冒昧提出 n. (Hazard) 哈泽德（人名）

sentences.english: Careless drivers hazard other people's lives as well as their own.
sentences.chinese: 粗心大意的驾驶者拿他人和自己的生命冒险。

sentences.english: Polluted water sources are a hazard to wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 受污染的水源会对野生生物构成危险。

detailed_translations.english: to risk sth or put it in danger
something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

name: regulator
trans: n. 监管机构，监管者；调整者；校准器

sentences.english: a heat regulator
sentences.chinese: 热调节器

detailed_translations.english: an instrument for controlling the temperature, speed etc of something

name: valve
trans: n. 阀；[解剖] 瓣膜；真空管；活门 vt. 装阀于；以活门调节 n. (Valve)人名；(俄、芬)瓦尔韦

sentences.english: heart valves
sentences.chinese: 心脏瓣膜

detailed_translations.english: a part of a tube or pipe that opens and shuts like a door to control the flow of liquid, gas, air etc passing through it

name: ally
trans: n. 同盟国；伙伴；同盟者；助手 vt. 使联盟；使联合 vi. 联合；结盟 n. (Ally)人名；(巴基)阿利；(法)阿利；(英)艾丽(女子教名 Alice 的简称)；(尼日利)阿利

sentences.english: a meeting of the European allies
sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟国会议

sentences.english: He will have no choice but to ally himself with the new movement.
sentences.chinese: 他将别无选择，只能与这个新运动结盟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同盟国；伙伴；同盟者；助手
detailed_translations.english: a country that agrees to help or support another country in a war
If you ally yourself with someone or something, you give your support to them

name: colonist
trans: n. 殖民者；殖民地居民；移民 adj. 殖民主义者的；奉行殖民主义的

sentences.english: The colonists struggled through their first winter.
sentences.chinese: 这些殖民地居民艰难地度过了第一个冬天。

detailed_translations.english: someone who settles in a new colony

name: delegate
trans: n. 代表，会议代表；委员会成员 v. 授（权），把……委托给他人；委派……为代表，任命

sentences.english: Around 350 delegates attended the conference.
sentences.chinese: 大约有350名代表参加了大会。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group

detailed_translations.chinese: 委派…为代表； 授 ， 把…委托给
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group, organization etc

name: revolution
trans: n. 革命；旋转；运行；循环

sentences.english: the French Revolution of 1789
sentences.chinese: 1789年法国大革命

sentences.english: the planets’ revolution around the sun
sentences.chinese: 行星围绕太阳的公转

detailed_translations.english: an attempt, by a large number of people, to change the government of a country, especially by violent action

name: eyewitness
trans: n. 目击者；见证人

sentences.english: One eyewitness said he saw her talking to a man in a blue car.
sentences.chinese: 一名目击者说他看见她在跟一个坐在蓝色汽车里的男子说话。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has seen something such as a crime happen, and is able to describe it afterwards

name: fingerprint
trans: n. 指纹；手印 vt. 采指纹

sentences.english: His fingerprints were all over the gun.
sentences.chinese: 枪上到处是他的指纹。

sentences.english: He was careful not to leave any fingerprints .
sentences.chinese: 他小心地不留下指纹。

sentences.english: The police questioned Beresford and took his fingerprints (= made a record of them ) .
sentences.chinese: 警察审问了贝雷斯福德，并提取了他的指纹。

sentences.english: He took her to jail, where she was fingerprinted and booked.
sentences.chinese: 他将她带到监狱，她在那里被提取了指纹并登记在册。

detailed_translations.english: a mark made by the pattern of lines at the end of a person’s finger, which is used by the police to find out who has committed a crime
If someone is fingerprinted, the police take their fingerprints

name: suspect
trans: v. 怀疑；猜想 n. 嫌疑犯 adj. 靠不住的；可疑的

sentences.english: She strongly suspected he was lying to her.
sentences.chinese: 她非常怀疑他在对她撒谎。

sentences.english: She’s not going to be very happy about this, I suspect .
sentences.chinese: 我想对于此事她不会太高兴。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, especially something bad
someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime

name: avid
trans: adj. 渴望的，贪婪的；热心的 n. (Avid)人名；(俄)阿维德

sentences.english: He misses not having enough books because he's an avid reader.
sentences.chinese: 他遗憾没有足够的书，因为他是一个热爱读书的人。

detailed_translations.english: You use avid to describe someone who is very enthusiastic about something that they do

name: conditioning
trans: n. 调节；条件作用；整修；训练，健身训练 v. 以…为条件（condition的ing形式）

name: endurance
trans: n. 忍耐力；耐久性；持续时间

sentences.english: She was pushed beyond her powers of endurance.
sentences.chinese: 她被逼得忍无可忍。

sentences.english: The marathon is a test of endurance.
sentences.chinese: 马拉松赛跑是对耐力的考验。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to continue doing something difficult or painful over a long period of time

name: formidable
trans: adj. 强大的；可怕的；令人敬畏的；艰难的

sentences.english: The building is grey, formidable, not at all picturesque.
sentences.chinese: 那幢建筑呈灰色，气势凛然，与漂亮沾不上边。

sentences.english: The new range of computers have formidable processing power.
sentences.chinese: 该系列的新型计算机处理能力惊人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕的；令人敬畏的，令人惊叹的
detailed_translations.english: very powerful or impressive, and often frightening

name: phenomenon
trans: n. 现象；奇迹；杰出的人才

sentences.english: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon .
sentences.chinese: 无家可归已不是什么新现象。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand

name: stamina
trans: n. 耐力，持久力，毅力；雄蕊（stamen 的复数） n. (Stamina) （俄、加、美）史大弥娜（人名）

sentences.english: You need stamina to be a long-distance runner.
sentences.chinese: 当长跑运动员需要耐力。

sentences.english: Elaine has the stamina and the determination to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 伊莱恩具有成功所需的毅力和决心。

detailed_translations.english: physical or mental strength that lets you continue doing something for a long time without getting tired

name: check
trans: vt. 检查，核对；制止，抑制；在…上打勾；托运 vi. 核实，查核；中止；打勾；[象棋]将一军 n. 支票；制止，抑制；检验，核对 n. （英）切克（人名）

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

name: goalie
trans: n. 守门员（等于goalkeeper）

name: playoff
trans: n. 双方得分相等时的最后决赛；复赛；季后赛

sentences.english: Nick Faldo was beaten by Peter Baker in a playoff.
sentences.chinese: 尼克·福尔多在加时赛中被彼得·贝克击败。

detailed_translations.chinese: 双方得分相等时的最后决赛；复赛；季后赛
detailed_translations.english: A playoff is an extra game that is played to decide the winner of a sports competition when two or more people have the same score

name: puck
trans: n. 冰球（由硬橡胶制成）；顽皮的小妖精；（英）鼠状定位器；欧夜莺；脾脱疽 n. (Puck)人名；(德)普克

name: commute
trans: vi. （搭乘车、船等）通勤；代偿 vt. 减刑；交换；用……交换；使……变成 n. 通勤（口语）

sentences.english: Baldry’s 20-year prison sentence was commuted to three years.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德里二十年的刑期被减至三年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘公交车上下班，经常乘车往返于两地
减； 折合， 折偿； 上下班交通
detailed_translations.english: to regularly travel a long distance to get to work

name: transportation
trans: n. 运输；运输系统；运输工具；流放

sentences.english: The city needs to improve its public transportation (= buses, trains etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 这座城市需要改善公共交通。

detailed_translations.english: a system or method for carrying passengers or goods from one place to another

name: awkward
trans: adj. 尴尬的；笨拙的；棘手的；不合适的

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

name: footwork
trans: n. 步法；需跑腿的工作；策略

sentences.english: This exercise improves your coordination, balance, timing and footwork.
sentences.chinese: 这项练习提高了你的体质、平衡力、时机掌握能力以及步法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 步法；需跑腿的工作；策略
detailed_translations.english: skilful use of your feet when dancing or playing a sport

name: rhythm
trans: n. 节奏；韵律

sentences.english: Drums are basic to African rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 非洲音乐节奏少不了鼓。

sentences.english: complicated dance rhythms
sentences.chinese: 复杂的舞蹈节奏

sentences.english: the body’s natural rhythms
sentences.chinese: 人体的自然节律

detailed_translations.english: a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements

name: talent
trans: n. 才能；天才；天资

sentences.english: He has a lot of talent , and his work is fresh and interesting.
sentences.chinese: 他很有天赋，作品新颖有趣。

sentences.english: a persuasive speaker with a natural talent for leadership
sentences.chinese: 有领导天赋、颇有辩才的演说者

sentences.english: His latest book reveals hidden talents.
sentences.chinese: 他最新的一本书展现了他深藏不露的才能。

sentences.english: Sadly, she inherited none of her father’s musical talent.
sentences.chinese: 可惜的是，她一点都没有继承她父亲的音乐天赋。

sentences.english: He is a great talent.
sentences.chinese: 他是个了不起的人才。

sentences.english: Britain’s footballing talent
sentences.chinese: 英国的足球天才

detailed_translations.english: a natural ability to do something well

name: apologize
trans: vi. 道歉；辩解；赔不是 vt. 道歉；谢罪；辩白

sentences.english: I’m so sorry, I do apologize.
sentences.chinese: 非常对不起，我真心道歉。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that you are sorry that you have done something wrong

name: camouflage
trans: n. 伪装，掩饰 vt. 伪装，掩饰 vi. 伪装起来

sentences.english: soldiers learning camouflage technique
sentences.chinese: 在学习伪装技术的士兵

sentences.english: the camouflage netting over the tanks
sentences.chinese: 坦克上的伪装网

detailed_translations.english: a way of hiding something, especially soldiers and military equipment, by using paint, leaves etc to make it look like the things around it
to hide something, especially by making it look the same as the things around it, or by making it seem like something else

name: disappoint
trans: vt. 使失望

sentences.english: I hated to disappoint her.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿意让她失望。

sentences.english: Great things were expected of this band, and they didn’t disappoint.
sentences.chinese: 大家对这支乐队的期望很高，而他们也不负众望。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy because something they hoped for did not happen or was not as good as they expected

name: divorce
trans: n. 离婚；分离；离婚判决；离婚的男子 v. 与（某人）离婚；分离，脱离；彻底分割

sentences.english: David’s parents divorced when he was six.
sentences.chinese: 戴维的父母在他六岁时离婚了。

sentences.english: My father threatened to divorce her.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲威胁说要和她离婚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离婚； 分离， 脱离
detailed_translations.english: if someone divorces their husband or wife, or if two people divorce, they legally end their marriage
the legal ending of a marriage

name: feedback
trans: n. 反馈；成果，资料；回复

sentences.english: How can I provide feedback without making someone angry?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样才能提出反馈意见又不会得罪人呢？

detailed_translations.english: advice, criticism etc about how successful or useful something is

name: radioactive
trans: adj. [核] 放射性的；有辐射的

sentences.english: the problem of how to dispose of radioactive waste
sentences.chinese: 如何处理放射性废物的问题

sentences.english: a consignment of highly radioactive plutonium
sentences.chinese: 发送的一批高放射性钚

detailed_translations.chinese: 放射性的， 有辐射能的
detailed_translations.english: a radioactive substance is dangerous because it contains  radiation (= a form of energy that can harm living things )

name: foremen
trans: [经管] 工长 工头

name: immigrant
trans: adj. 移民的；迁入的 n. 移民，侨民

sentences.english: an illegal immigrant
sentences.chinese: 非法移民

sentences.english: a new wave of immigrants from the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 来自中东的一股新兴的移民浪潮

detailed_translations.english: someone who enters another country to live there permanently

name: laborer
trans: n. 劳动者；工人

sentences.english: Traditionally cut blue jeans carry a whiff of the laborer about them, so denim on a leader suggests a willingness to roll up the sleeves and dig in.
sentences.chinese: 传统剪裁的蓝色牛仔裤带有一种劳动者的气息，因此领导者穿着仔裤可以表达一种愿意卷起袖子大干一场的意思。

sentences.english: It is no use offering the manual laborer, tired out with a hard week’s sweat and effort, the chance of playing a game of football or baseball on Saturday afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 对于那些体力劳动者来说，一周辛苦的工作使他们精疾力竭，因此在周六下午给他们提供踢足球或者打棒球的机会是没有意义的。

sentences.english: Basically, in 2009, the life of a wage laborer has the same essential features in every corner of the globe.
sentences.chinese: 在2009年，工资劳动者的生活，其基本特征在全球的各个角落都是大致相同的。

name: settler
trans: n. 移居者；殖民者 n. (Settler)人名；(德)泽特勒

sentences.english: early settlers in Australia
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚的早期移民

detailed_translations.english: someone who goes to live in a country or area where not many people like them have lived before, and that is a long way from any towns or cities

name: veteran
trans: n. 老兵；老手；富有经验的人；老运动员 adj. 经验丰富的；老兵的

sentences.english: He is a veteran of the last revolution in medical technology, gene therapy, which, after some hyped expectations in the 1990s, fell into disfavor after some unsuccessful trials.
sentences.chinese: 他是基因治疗这项最新医学技术的老手，经过了1990年代的兴奋期和之后几次失败的实验后，基因治疗技术已经失宠了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been a soldier, sailor etc in a war

name: archaeological
trans: adj. [古] 考古学的；[古] 考古学上的

sentences.english: Just who made the tools is unclear from the archaeological evidence alone, though our relative Homo erectus is identified as the likely creator of at least the Acheulian tools.
sentences.chinese: 尽管已经确定我们的近亲直立人至少是阿舍利工具可能的创造者，但仅凭考古学证据还无法确定是谁制造了这些工具。

sentences.english: So there are two other models, then, models different from the immigration model, two other models for understanding the formation of Israel, that build on this archaeological evidence.
sentences.chinese: 那么还有两个其他的模型，与移民模型不同的两个模型，这两个模型也是为了说明以色列的形成，它们是依据考古学证据。

sentences.english: The work fills (in) a gap which has hitherto existed in our archaeological literature.
sentences.chinese: 这部著作填补了我国考古学文献中的一个空白。

name: artifact
trans: n. 人工制品，手工艺品；非自然存在物体（artefact 的另一种拼法）

sentences.english: In the wrong hands this powerful artifact has the ability to unravel the soul.
sentences.chinese: 在错误手这强有力的人工制品有能力解开灵魂。

name: blog
trans: n. 网络日志，博客 v. 写博客

sentences.english: When Barbieux started his blog, his aspirations were small; he simply hoped to communicate with a few people.
sentences.chinese: 当巴布开始他的博客时，他的期望并不大。他只是希望能与几个人交流。

detailed_translations.english: a web page containing information or opinions from a particular person or about a particular subject, to which new information is added regularly

name: expedition
trans: n. 远征；探险队；迅速

sentences.english: an expedition to the North Pole
sentences.chinese: 北极探险

sentences.english: another Qomolangma expedition
sentences.chinese: 又一次珠穆朗玛峰探险

detailed_translations.english: a long and carefully organized journey, especially to a dangerous or unfamiliar place, or the people that make this journey

name: submersible
trans: adj. 能潜水的；能沉入水中的

name: flax
trans: n. 亚麻；亚麻纤维；亚麻布；亚麻织品 n. (Flax)人名；(英、法、西、捷)弗拉克斯

sentences.english: Cherries, sunflower and flax seeds have traces of this hormone.
sentences.chinese: 樱桃，向日葵籽和亚麻籽都含有这种荷尔蒙。

sentences.english: He understood well the importance of international trade and the potential wealth to be gained from the export of flax, hemp, pitch, furs, hides and timber.
sentences.chinese: 他非常了解国际贸易的重要性，以及亚麻、大麻、沥青、皮草、兽皮和木材等物资出口所能获得的巨大潜在财富。

sentences.english: Both soybeans and flax showed changes in their proteins, but not enough to stop them from thriving in the soil contaminated by the 1986 disaster.
sentences.chinese: 1986年灾后，大豆和亚麻的蛋白质有所改变，但这不足以阻止它们在受到污染的土壤中发芽。

detailed_translations.english: a plant with blue flowers, used for making cloth and oil

name: overseer
trans: n. 监督；工头

name: assimilate
trans: vt. 吸收；使同化；把…比作；使相似 vi. 吸收；同化

sentences.english: It will take time to assimilate all these facts.
sentences.chinese: 充分掌握所有这些情况需要时间。

detailed_translations.english: to completely understand and begin to use new ideas, information etc
if people assimilate, or are assimilated into a country or group, they become part of that group and are accepted by the people in that group

name: endangered
trans: adj. 濒临灭绝的；有生命危险的

sentences.english: I think there are many endangered animals in the world, such as tigers and pandas.
sentences.chinese: 我认为有许多濒临灭绝的动物，如老虎和大熊猫，在世界。

sentences.english: I think our government should punish those people severely who kill the rare animals. It is our duty to protect the endangered animals.
sentences.chinese: 我认为政府应该严厉惩罚那些捕杀稀有动物的人。保护濒临灭绝的动物是我们的责任。

sentences.english: However, it holds six language families, two of which have only one remaining language, and almost all of the languages here are endangered.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它拥有六个语族，其中两个语族仅剩下一种语言，而且这儿几乎所有的语言都濒临灭绝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 濒危的， 将要灭绝的

name: indigenous
trans: adj. 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的

sentences.english: the many indigenous cultures which existed in Siberia
sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

detailed_translations.chinese: 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的
detailed_translations.english: indigenous people or things have always been in the place where they are, rather than being brought there from somewhere else

name: preserve
trans: vt. 保存；保护；维持；腌；禁猎 n. 保护区；禁猎地；加工成的食品；（某人或群体的）专门活动

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: airs
trans: abbr. 自动信息检索系统（Automatic Information Retrieval System）；机载综合侦察系统（Airborne Integrated Reconnaissance System） n. (Airs)人名；(英)艾尔斯

name: shabby
trans: adj. 破旧的；卑鄙的；吝啬的；低劣的

sentences.english: Hugh’s jacket was old and shabby.
sentences.chinese: 休的夹克衫又旧又破。

sentences.english: a shabby little restaurant
sentences.chinese: 一家肮脏的小餐馆

sentences.english: a shabby tramp
sentences.chinese: 一个衣衫褴褛的流浪汉

detailed_translations.english: shabby clothes, places, or objects are untidy and in bad condition because they have been used for a long time

name: snub
trans: v. 冷落；斥责；抵制；（使）（马、船等）停住；掐灭（香烟等） n. 冷落；止住 adj. （鼻子）短平而上翘的

sentences.english: the boys who had snubbed her in high school
sentences.chinese: 在中学里曾经冷落她的那些男孩

detailed_translations.english: to treat someone rudely, especially by ignoring them when you meet
an act of snubbing someone

name: splendid
trans: adj. 辉煌的；灿烂的；极好的；杰出的

sentences.english: a splendid idea
sentences.chinese: 很妙的主意

sentences.english: a splendid opportunity
sentences.chinese: 绝佳的机会

sentences.english: The staff are doing a splendid job.
sentences.chinese: 员工们干得非常棒。

detailed_translations.english: very good

name: threadbare
