sentences.english: She turned on the charm (= used her charm ) to all the men.
sentences.chinese: 她对所有那些男人都施展魅力。

sentences.english: The room had no windows and all the charm of a prison cell (= used to say that something has no charm ) .
sentences.chinese: 这房间没有窗，简直就是牢房。

detailed_translations.english: a special quality someone or something has that makes people like them, feel attracted to them, or be easily influenced by them – used to show approval

name: compel
trans: vt. 强迫，迫使；强使发生 n. (Compel)人名；(法)孔佩尔

sentences.english: ...the introduction of legislation to compel cyclists to wear a helmet.
sentences.chinese: …强制骑车人戴头盔的法律的引入。

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to do something

name: enormous
trans: adj. 庞大的，巨大的；凶暴的，极恶的

sentences.english: an enormous bunch of flowers
sentences.chinese: 巨大的花束

sentences.english: an enormous amount of money
sentences.chinese: 巨款

sentences.english: The team made an enormous effort.
sentences.chinese: 该队付出了巨大的努力。

detailed_translations.english: very big in size or in amount

name: locks
trans: n. 锁；水闸；锁定器（lock的复数） v. 锁上；卡住；使紧密相连；紧抱住（lock的三单形式）

name: meek
trans: adj. 温顺的；谦恭的；驯服的 n. (Meek)人名；(英)米克

sentences.english: He was always so meek and mild .
sentences.chinese: 他总是那么温顺。

detailed_translations.english: very quiet and gentle and unwilling to argue with people

name: cunning
trans: adj. 狡猾的；巧妙的；可爱的 n. 狡猾

sentences.english: a cunning opponent
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的对手

detailed_translations.english: someone who is cunning is clever and good at deceiving people in order to get what they want
the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

name: dread
trans: v. 惧怕，担心；敬畏 n. 恐惧，可怕的人（或物）；（鸟群的）惊飞，惊起；将头发编成“骇人”发型的人 adj. 可怕的；令人敬畏的

sentences.english: The prospect of flying filled me with dread .
sentences.chinese: 想到要乘飞机我充满了恐惧。

sentences.english: She lives in dread of (= is continuously very afraid of ) the disease returning.
sentences.chinese: 她整天担心着会旧病复发。

detailed_translations.english: a strong fear of something that is going to happen or may happen
to feel anxious or worried about something that is going to happen or may happen

name: invisible
trans: adj. 无形的，看不见的；无形的；不显眼的，暗藏的

sentences.english: The house was surrounded by trees, and invisible from the road.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子树木环绕，从路上是看不见的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is invisible cannot be seen

name: simple
trans: adj. 简单的；单纯的；天真的 n. 笨蛋；愚蠢的行为；出身低微者 n. (Simple)人名；(法)桑普勒

sentences.english: Completing the race is not just a simple matter of physical fitness.
sentences.chinese: 跑完比赛不仅仅是纯粹的体力问题。

sentences.english: I’m afraid Luke’s a bit simple.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得卢克有点笨。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that only one thing is involved

name: telescope
trans: n. 望远镜 v. 叠套缩短；精简，压缩；（车）相撞而嵌进

sentences.english: The captain was rectifying his telescope.
sentences.chinese: 船长正在调他的望远镜。

sentences.english: The telescope reveals many distant stars to our sight.
sentences.chinese: 望远镜把许多遥远的星球显现在我们的眼前。

sentences.english: With the aid of a telescope a ship could be made out on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 借助望远镜可以看出在地平线上有一只船。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment shaped like a tube, used for making distant objects look larger and closer

name: cruelty
trans: n. 残酷；残忍；残酷的行为

sentences.english: The children had suffered cruelty and neglect.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子遭受虐待，无人照管。

sentences.english: There was a hint of cruelty in Brian’s smile.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩的微笑里流露出一丝残暴。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour or actions that deliberately cause pain to people or animals

name: plight
trans: n. 困境；境况；誓约 vt. 保证；约定

sentences.english: the country’s economic plight
sentences.chinese: 该国的经济困境

sentences.english: he plighted his word to attempt it

detailed_translations.english: a very bad situation that someone is in
to give or pledge (one's word)

name: reunite
trans: vt. 使重聚；使再结合；使再联合 vi. 重聚；再结合；再联合

sentences.english: The band will reunite for a US tour.
sentences.chinese: 乐队将重聚作美国巡演。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使重聚；使再结合；使再联合
detailed_translations.english: to come together again or to bring people, parts of an organization, political party, or country together again

name: solder
trans: n. 焊料；接合物 v. 焊接；使联接在一起

sentences.english: Each sculptural planter is made-to-order with handmade glass and lead-free solder and comes with everything you need but the plants.
sentences.chinese: 每个艺术花盆都是定制的。 它们由手工制作的玻璃和无铅焊料接合而成，交付使用时，万事俱备，只欠花卉。

sentences.english: This superior reliability comes from advances in packaging techniques and epitaxial structure, together with the use of hard solder construction.
sentences.chinese: 这种超级可靠性来自于封装技术和外延结构的发展，也得益于硬焊接架构的使用。

sentences.english: You can either solder them together properly with a metal strip on the front, or just try positioning the metal correctly inside the case with the cells.
sentences.chinese: 你可以使用前面的金属条将他们焊在一起，或者只是定位好电池盒里面的电池单元的金属条。

detailed_translations.english: a soft metal, usually a mixture of  lead  and  tin  , which can be melted and used to join two metal surfaces, wires etc
to join or repair metal surfaces with solder

name: spare
trans: adj. 额外的，备用的；多余的；瘦高的，瘦长的；简朴的；未装饰的；空闲的；少量的；节约的 v. 饶恕；不伤害；不毁坏；使避免；（尤指在自己困难的情况下）抽出，匀出；剩下；分让；节约；吝惜；删节 n. 备用品；（汽车或其他设备的）备用零件，配件；（十柱保龄球戏中的）二击全倒 n. (Spare)（美、英、瑞典、加、拉脱维亚、印、法）史琶尔（人名）

sentences.english: Sorry, I can’t spare the time.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我抽不出时间。

sentences.english: Have you got any spare boxes?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有多余的盒子？

sentences.english: You could sleep in the spare bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 你可以睡那间空着的客房。

sentences.english: Do you have any spare cash?
sentences.chinese: 你手头有闲钱吗？

sentences.english: I’ll go and see if there are any spare seats.
sentences.chinese: 我去看看是否还有空余的座位。

sentences.english: A decline in beer sales had left the industry with spare capacity (= the ability to produce more than can be sold ) .
sentences.chinese: 啤酒销售量的下降使该行业出现产能闲置。

detailed_translations.english: to make something such as time, money, or workers available for someone, especially when this is difficult for you to do
not being used or not needed at the present time

name: tramp
trans: v. （尤指长时间地）重步行走；（艰难地）长途跋涉；踩，踏 n. 流浪汉；沉重的脚步声；徒步旅行；（尤指令人疲惫的）长途跋涉；（航线不定的）货船；（非正式）淫妇；金属片；铲尖 n. (Tramp) （美）塔姆鄱（人名）

sentences.english: I met a tramp and gave him some money on my way home.
sentences.chinese: 我回家的路上碰到了一个流浪汉并给了他一些钱。

sentences.english: Five minutes inside the soup-kitchen in Hackney, east London, and I immediately understand what Orwell meant - that the "typical tramp" does not exist.
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦东面哈克尼的汤棚里呆了五分钟，我立刻明白了奥威尔那句“‘典型的流浪汉’不存在”是什么意思。

sentences.english: A tramp does not see such a meal twice in the year, in the spike or out of it.
sentences.chinese: 对于一个流浪汉而言，不论是在收容站还是在外面，如此丰盛的饭食他是见不到第二次的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has no home or job and moves from place to place, often asking for food or money

name: bewilderment
trans: n. 困惑；迷乱；慌张

name: humbug
trans: n. 骗子；欺骗；谎话 vt. 欺骗；哄骗 vi. 行骗

sentences.english: He dismissed the prime minister’s comments as ‘pure humbug’.
sentences.chinese: 他对首相的评论不屑一顾，认为是“纯粹的假道学”。

detailed_translations.english: insincere or dishonest words or behaviour

name: imitate
trans: vt. 模仿，仿效；仿造，仿制

sentences.english: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 她是个出色的模仿者，喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。

sentences.english: The Japanese have no wish to imitate Western social customs and attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 日本人无意仿效西方的社会习俗和处事态度。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

name: ventriloquist
trans: n. 腹语术者；口技艺人

sentences.english: The Army was showing off its new MREs for Afghanistan, and there were sleeping models, a ventriloquist's dummy and a belly dancer.
sentences.chinese: 军队闪耀他对阿富汗新的宗教教育，有睡眠模特，口技表演者，跳肚皮舞的舞者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口技表演者， 腹语表演者
detailed_translations.english: someone who entertains people by speaking without moving their lips and making it seem that the words are spoken by a model of a person called a dummy

name: vexed
trans: adj. 生气的，烦恼的，恼怒的；为难的；焦急的

name: division
trans: n. [数] 除法；部门；分配；分割；师（军队）；赛区

sentences.english: the division sign (÷)
sentences.chinese: 除号

sentences.english: the Computer Services Division
sentences.chinese: 电脑维修部

detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out how many times one number is contained in another

name: league
trans: n. 联盟；社团；范畴 vt. 使…结盟；与…联合 vi. 团结；结盟 n. (League)人名；(英)利格

sentences.english: the National Socialist League
sentences.chinese: 国家社会主义联盟

detailed_translations.english: a group of people or countries who have joined together because they have similar aims, political beliefs etc

name: season
trans: n. 时期；季节；赛季 vt. 给…调味；使适应 vi. 变得成熟；变干燥

sentences.english: the effect on plants as the seasons start to change
sentences.chinese: 换季对植物的影响

detailed_translations.english: one of the main periods into which a year is divided, each of which has a particular type of weather. The seasons are spring, summer, autumn, and winter
to add salt, pepper etc to food you are cooking

name: campaign
trans: n. 运动；活动；战役，军事行动；竞选 v. 领导或参加运动；参加竞选

sentences.english: Jones ran a good campaign.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯的活动搞得很成功。

sentences.english: Police have launched a campaign to crack down on drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 警方发起了一场严厉打击毒贩的运动。

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions intended to achieve a particular result relating to politics or business, or a social improvement

name: nominee
trans: n. 被任命者；被提名的人；代名人

sentences.english: the Democratic Party presidential nominee
sentences.chinese: 民主党被提名的总统候选人

detailed_translations.chinese: 被任命者；被提名的人；代名人
detailed_translations.english: someone who has been officially suggested for an important position, duty, or prize

name: politician
trans: n. 政治家，政客

sentences.english: politicians who are trying to get the minority vote
sentences.chinese: 努力争取少数族群选票的政治家

sentences.english: a British Labour politician
sentences.chinese: 英国工党政治家

detailed_translations.english: someone who works in politics, especially an elected member of the government

name: controversial
trans: adj. 有争议的；有争论的

sentences.english: the controversial issue of welfare reform
sentences.chinese: 福利改革这一有争议的话题

sentences.english: a highly controversial (= very controversial ) plan to flood the valley in order to build a dam
sentences.chinese: 一个把山谷淹掉来建造水坝的极具争议的计划

sentences.english: He is a controversial figure (= person who does controversial things ) in the art world.
sentences.chinese: 他是艺术界极具争议的人物。

detailed_translations.english: causing a lot of disagreement, because many people have strong opinions about the subject being discussed

name: outdated
trans: adj. 过时的；旧式的 v. 使过时（outdate的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: outdated teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 不合时宜的教学方法

sentences.english: a factory with outdated equipment
sentences.chinese: 设备陈旧的工厂

sentences.english: His writing style is now boring and outdated.
sentences.chinese: 他的写作风格如今已显得乏味而过时了。

detailed_translations.english: if something is outdated, it is no longer considered useful or effective, because something more modern exists

name: steward
trans: n. 管家；乘务员；膳务员；工会管事 vi. 当服务员；当管事 vt. 管理 n. (Steward)人名；(英)斯图尔德

sentences.english: race stewards
sentences.chinese: 比赛组织者

detailed_translations.chinese: 管家；乘务员；膳务员；工会管事
detailed_translations.english: a man whose job is to serve food and drinks to passengers on a plane or ship
